Going to take a couple days off of here and other sites. After 10 days being fever free, it’s back with a vengeance tonight. I have no words for all of this. Just want peace emotionally and physically.
@FeldbergPaul Thank you! You too. After 10 days fever free, it’s back.

@YuliaS31080475 I’m hoping you can recover soon. Just take it easy and don’t push yourself if you feel better even for a day. Overdoing it seems to be what makes symptoms worse or return. I’m on day 71 today and fortunately fever is gone after 61 days but other issues remain.
@RafaelOsswald I fortunately never had the lung issues! The tachyardia is constant though and without a fever present anymore, it can be blamed on that.
@amymurnan @ClaireHastie1 How long did you feel better for? I’m on day 9 or 10 without fever which is the longest I’ve gone without one. Hoping I never have to relapse fever wise.

Day 70 of Covid-19 recovery. Fortunate to not have a fever anymore but I lay here with a 117 bpm heart rate and horrible chest pain. Doctor suspects it could be pericarditis but I can’t get imaging done in his office yet. This is brutal. Tempted to go to ER tonight. 😞
@JHMarble This is my life too.  61 days. My life has been completely upended. Fever every day among other symptoms and now the virus has affected my heart muscles. Is this real life?

@OsswaldRafael This has to be explored! It’s crazy how many people are living this right now. While not death, a tragedy. It’s almost 4am here and my chest feels like it’s going to explode and my fever is making me feel so hot😔 haven’t slept yet. Day 61
@imam_lawal I am so sorry. Insomnia is also a new one for me. Fever for 60 days. You are not alone. ❤️

Day 60 with a fever and a host of other symptoms. That’s over 1,400 hours of feeling like hell. 

This is unreal.

@DusterCharles Absolutely agree. I’ve been so happy to barely have a fever over the past 4 days & if I had one, it was under 100 but this afternoon, it came back and I’m feeling quite rough. Hope you join us in the support groups. It does help make this difficult journey just a little easier.

@koosman2pointOh She is so lucky. I’m day 52 and still have low grade fever and more.

@ajhinkle The tests are absolute garbage. It had been 38 days but... the second test didn’t hurt at all - I felt they didn’t go high up enough if that makes sense. So many false tests that I’m not sure. I’m still quarantining because my fever has been present every day at some point. :/

@Ju4nMm It’s a low grade persistent fever and I went to the ER last week for shortness of breath, chest pain and heart palpitations. They only found sinus tachyardia and said it was likely due to fever but blood work was ok so i was discharged.

@rattledcage @JasonBo31842512 @erikaedwardsnbc They absolutely come and go. I’ll be fever free for hours and then it’ll come back and then a half hour, be gone... it’s insanity. Lately they’ve been more persistent but a “peekaboo” frequency seems pretty accurate!
@BrandieselKelly @erikaedwardsnbc Oh my goodness... rough! So glad the fever broke. I’m hoping you’re getting better as the days go on.
